text.front:
Axially symmetric solutions in f (R)-gravity
Salvatore Capozziello 1 , Mariafelicia De Laurentis 1 , Arturo Stabile 2
1 Dipartimento di Scienze Fisiche, Università di Napoli "Federico II", INFN Sez. di Napoli,
Compl. Univ. di Monte S. Angelo,
Edificio G, Via Cinthia, I-80126, Napoli, Italy
2 Dipartimento di Ingegneria, Università del Sannio,
Benevento, C.so Garibaldi 107, I-80125 Benevento, Italy
(Dated: May 11, 2010 )
Axially symmetric solutions for f (R)-gravity can be derived starting from exact spherically sym-
metric solutions achieved by Noether symmetries. The method takes advantage of a complex coordi-
nate transformation previously developed by Newman and Janis in General Relativity. An example
is worked out to show the general validity of the approach. The physical properties of the solution
are also considered.
PACS numbers: 98.80.-k, 95.35.+x, 95.35.+d, 04.50.+h
